(Chorus) When you can't be near me, oh, my lonesome soul, Keep me in your rearview, where the heartaches roll. Sing my name like a jukebox, broken, wild, and free, When you can't be near me, please think of me.
(Verse 2) I'm thumbin' through old photos, on this cracked phone screen, Your smile's a ghost now, in this lonesome scene. Got your voice in my head, like a steel guitar's cry, Keeps me holdin' on, beneath this empty sky.
(Pre-Chorus) The barstool's creakin', but it ain't my home, Without your touch, I'm destined to roam.
(Chorus) When you can't be near me, oh, my lonesome soul, Keep me in your rearview, where the heartaches roll. Sing my name like a jukebox, broken, wild, and free, When you can't be near me, please think of me.
(Bridge) So raise a glass, wherever you ride, Send a prayer on the wind, to the lonesome side. We'll cross paths again, down some dusty road, Till then, I'm carryin' this heavy load.
(Chorus) When you can't be near me, oh, my lonesome soul, Keep me in your rearview, where the heartaches roll. Sing my name like a jukebox, broken, wild, and free, When you can't be near me, please think of me.
(Outro) So when you're out there, under neon's glow, I'm still your rebel, in the shadows, you know. Till we're back together, where we're meant to be, When you can't be near me... please think of me. Yeah, think of me. (Oh, my lonesome soul.) Think of me.

whiskey_dont_lie.title: Whiskey Don't Lie
whiskey_dont_lie.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
I’m sittin’ at this barstool, with a neon glow,
Pourin’ out my heartache, where the jukebox flows.
The bartender knows me, he don’t ask my name,
Just slides another whiskey, to kill the pain.
(Pre-Chorus)
This dive bar’s my church, where the sinners pray,
Spillin’ out their stories, till the break of day.
(Chorus)
Whiskey don’t lie, it tells it straight,
Burns like the truth, no need to wait!
Raise your glass high, let the heartache fly,
Sing it loud, boys, whiskey don’t lie!
(Verse 2)
The gal I loved, she’s gone, took my ramblin’ heart,
Left me with this bottle, and a brand-new scar.
But this amber fire, it don’t judge my sins,
Just lights up the shadows, where my night begins.
(Pre-Chorus)
The jukebox is wailin’, but it can’t compare,
To the truth in this glass, and the pain we share.
(Chorus)
Whiskey don’t lie, it tells it straight,
Burns like the truth, no need to wait!
Raise your glass high, let the heartache fly,
Sing it loud, boys, whiskey don’t lie!
(Bridge)
So here’s to the lost, and the ones we miss,
To the fights and the nights, sealed with a kiss.
Every drop’s a preacher, every sip’s a song,
Sing it with me, brothers, we’ll howl all night long!
(Chorus)
Whiskey don’t lie, it tells it straight,
Burns like the truth, no need to wait!
Raise your glass high, let the heartache fly,
Sing it loud, boys, whiskey don’t lie!
(Outro)
When the barroom’s empty, and the stars burn low,
I’ll stumble to the highway, with nowhere to go.
But I’ll carry this gospel, till the day I die,
Sing it one more time—whiskey don’t lie!
Yeah, whiskey don’t lie! (Raise ‘em up high!)
Whiskey don’t lie!
Acoustic sound: A stripped-down, raw acoustic arrangement with a steady strumming pattern highlights the song's heartache, while a mournful fiddle weaves in and out, emphasizing the lament. The vocal delivery is gritty and vulnerable, carrying the story's emotional weight with a conversational honesty.
Potential Sound:
Outlaw Country Vibe: The song channels the raw, rebellious spirit of outlaw country with vivid imagery (neon, jukeboxes, barstools) and a narrator who’s both broken and defiant. The whiskey serves as a metaphor for unfiltered truth, tying into the genre’s honesty. Singalong Energy: The repetitive chorus (“Whiskey don’t lie, it tells it straight”) and simple, anthemic hooks are designed for a crowd to shout along, with gang vocals and a bridge that rallies everyone to join in. Modern Touches: References to phones or modern heartbreak are subtle, keeping the focus on timeless barroom camaraderie, but the tone feels relatable for 2025. Performance: Picture this in a sweaty honky-tonk or a modern country musical, with a charismatic frontman leading a raucous band (electric guitar, fiddle, piano, drums). The crowd stomps boots, clinks bottles, and sings the chorus at the top of their lungs.

backroad_heart.title: Backroad Heart
backroad_heart.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Out on County Road 9, where the gravel kicks dust,
We carved our initials in an oak, swore we’d never rust.
Your taillights faded, left me standin’ in the rain,
Now I’m chasin’ your memory, down a lonesome lane.
(Pre-Chorus)
This old truck’s still runnin’, but it’s fallin’ apart,
Just like me, it’s haulin’ this backroad heart.
(Chorus)
I’ve got a backroad heart, beat-up but true,
Burnin’ like a bonfire, still in love with you.
Through the mud and the miles, I’m holdin’ on tight,
A backroad heart keeps rollin’ through the long, dark night.
(Verse 2)
The radio’s playin’ that song you used to sing,
About a small-town dreamer, chasin’ bigger things.
I pass your mama’s porch light, it’s glowin’ soft and low,
Wish I could turn back time, to nights we used to know.
(Pre-Chorus)
This flannel’s worn thin, but I wear it with pride,
Like this backroad heart, still fightin’ for the ride.
(Chorus)
I’ve got a backroad heart, beat-up but true,
Burnin’ like a bonfire, still in love with you.
Through the mud and the miles, I’m holdin’ on tight,
A backroad heart keeps rollin’ through the long, dark night.
(Bridge)
Every cornfield sunrise, every starlit prayer,
I see your face in the distance, like you’re still right there.
I ain’t the kind to give up, I was raised to stand tall,
This backroad heart’s still beatin’, through the rise and fall.
(Chorus)
I’ve got a backroad heart, beat-up but true,
Burnin’ like a bonfire, still in love with you.
Through the mud and the miles, I’m holdin’ on tight,
A backroad heart keeps rollin’ through the long, dark night.
(Outro)
So I’ll drive these old backroads, till the pain departs,
Carrying the weight of this lonesome, backroad heart.
Yeah, this backroad heart… keeps rollin’ on.
Acoustic sound: Strong, steady acoustic guitar strum and simple, heartfelt vocals that emphasize the story's raw emotion. A gentle pedal steel or subtle fiddle melody weaves in and out, adding a layer of wistful nostalgia.

run_from_the_reaper.title: Run From the Reaper
run_from_the_reaper.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
The dust kicks up behind me, on this lonesome road,
My boots are worn to nothin’, carryin’ this load.
Got a warrant in my pocket, and a devil on my trail,
Runnin’ from the reaper, but I’m bound to fail.
(Pre-Chorus)
The wind’s howlin’ my name, through the midnight air,
Ghosts of my sins, they’re closin’ in there.
(Chorus)
Run from the reaper, but he’s closin’ in,
Hears my heart a-beatin’, smells my every sin.
Through the canyons and the shadows, I’ll ride till I’m free,
Run from the reaper, but he’s comin’ for me.
(Verse 2)
My old Chevy’s screamin’, tires spittin’ gravel fast,
Chasin’ down redemption, but I’m haunted by the past.
Every milepost mocks me, every star burns cold,
This outlaw’s soul’s too heavy, for the stories I’ve told.
(Pre-Chorus)
The law’s lights are flashin’, in my rearview glow,
But the reaper’s shadow’s darker, and he won’t let go.
(Chorus)
Run from the reaper, but he’s closin’ in,
Hears my heart a-beatin’, smells my every sin.
Through the canyons and the shadows, I’ll ride till I’m free,
Run from the reaper, but he’s comin’ for me.
(Bridge)
I’ve burned too many bridges, left too many scars,
Stole a piece of heaven, under these cruel stars.
But if I keep on runnin’, maybe I’ll outsmart,
That cold hand of fate, tearin’ at my heart.
(Chorus)
Run from the reaper, but he’s closin’ in,
Hears my heart a-beatin’, smells my every sin.
Through the canyons and the shadows, I’ll ride till I’m free,
Run from the reaper, but he’s comin’ for me.
(Outro)
So I’ll race this endless highway, till my engine dies,
With the reaper in my mirror, and fire in my eyes.
One last shot at freedom, one last rebel plea,
Run from the reaper… but he’s comin’ for me.
Yeah, he’s comin’ for me. (Keep on runnin’ free.)
Comin’ for me.
Acoustic sound: A raw, heart-pounding acoustic ballad with an urgent, mid-tempo pulse blends stripped-down vulnerability with fierce intensity, anchored by driving guitar and weathered, urgent vocals that evoke a high-stakes personal journey.
Potential Sound:
A high-octane outlaw country rocker with a driving, mid-to-up-tempo pulse, blending gritty authenticity with cinematic intensity. Anchored by twangy electric guitars and a relentless acoustic strum, the track pulses with a galloping kick drum and a deep, rumbling bassline, evoking a fugitive’s desperate ride. A searing pedal steel wail and occasional banjo plucks add raw country soul, while sparse harmonica stabs heighten the tension. The vocal delivery is weathered and urgent, with gritty, conversational phrasing and subtle backing harmonies that carry a ghostly edge. The tone is rebellious, desperate, and vivid, conjuring a lone outlaw tearing through a desert under a blood-red sky, perfect for a high-stakes Western chase scene, a modern country musical climax, or a road-trip playlist staple.
Why It’s Not a Ballad:
Tempo and Energy: The song now has a faster, driving rhythm, with a galloping beat and urgent guitar riffs that evoke a chase rather than a slow, mournful ballad. The energy is high, pushing the narrative forward like a fugitive on the run. Outlaw Country Core: It retains the genre’s raw storytelling, with vivid imagery (dusty roads, warrants, Chevy trucks) and themes of regret and defiance, but the tempo and instrumentation (electric guitars, kick drum) give it a rocker’s edge, appealing to fans of both classic and modern country. Phrasing: The Bye Bye Birdie-inspired short, rhythmic lines (“Run from the reaper, but he’s closin’ in”) remain, delivered with a conversational, almost frantic cadence that suits the chase narrative and keeps the song catchy. Mainstream Potential: The driving beat, anthemic chorus, and cinematic vibe give it crossover appeal, similar to high-energy country hits that blend outlaw grit with radio-ready hooks. Sound::
Vibe: The song feels like a high-stakes escape, with the reaper as both a literal and metaphorical pursuer. It’s gritty enough for purists but polished enough for a broader audience, with a sound that could fit a modern country festival or a film soundtrack. Performance: Envision this in a smoky roadhouse or a dramatic musical scene, with a rugged singer in a leather jacket, backed by a tight band (electric guitar, banjo, pedal steel, drums). The chorus could ignite a crowd to stomp and sing along, while the bridge offers a moment of raw intensity. Imagery and Themes: The lyrics paint a vivid picture of a fugitive’s life—dusty trails, flashing lights, burning bridges—while hinting at redemption, keeping the emotional depth intact.

under_a_southern_sky.title: Under a Southern Sky
under_a_southern_sky.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
I was runnin’ on empty, down a two-lane road,
Chasin’ whiskey sunsets, with a heavy load.
Left my dreams in a dive bar, thought I’d lost my way,
Till your smile lit the darkness, like a summer day.
(Pre-Chorus)
This old heart was wanderin’, till you called my name,
Now I’m standin’ in the starlight, and I’ll never be the same.
(Chorus)
I find my heart, find my soul, find you under a southern sky,
Where the pines whisper secrets, and the fireflies fly.
With your hand in mine, I’m alive, I’m whole,
I find my heart, find my soul, under a southern sky.
(Verse 2)
We danced in the moonlight, by a creek’s soft hum,
Barefoot on the red dirt, to a banjo’s strum.
Your laughter’s my compass, through the highs and lows,
You’re the home I never knew, where my restless spirit goes.
(Pre-Chorus)
No more lone-star highways, no more lonesome fights,
You’re my rebel redemption, in the glow of the night.
(Chorus)
I find my heart, find my soul, find you under a southern sky,
Where the pines whisper secrets, and the fireflies fly.
With your hand in mine, I’m alive, I’m whole,
I find my heart, find my soul, under a southern sky.
(Bridge)
We’ve got scars from the battles, we’ve got stories to tell,
From the honky-tonk heartaches to the heavens we fell.
But under these stars, with you by my side,
I’ve found my forever, on this wild, sweet ride.
(Chorus)
I find my heart, find my soul, find you under a southern sky,
Where the pines whisper secrets, and the fireflies fly.
With your hand in mine, I’m alive, I’m whole,
I find my heart, find my soul, under a southern sky.
(Outro)
So let’s chase the horizon, where the dawn breaks wide,
With you, I’m unbroken, on this southern sky ride.
I find my heart, find my soul, forever you and I,
Under a southern sky… under a southern sky.

whispers_from_the_hemlock_holler.title: Whispers from the Hemlock Holler
whispers_from_the_hemlock_holler.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Creek water whisperin' secrets low,
'Bout the mountain's wisdom, slow and slow.
Hemlock shadows stretchin' long and deep,
Peace in the silence, secrets to keep.
Campfire light a-flickerin' in the night,
Stars above, burnin' ever so bright.
(Chorus)
Old man mountain, he don't speak a word,
But lessons learned, ain't never heard
In no dusty book or preacher's plea,
Just the wind's sigh in the old oak tree.
Truth ain't found in the city's glare,
It's here in the hollers, hangin' in the air.
(Verse 2)
Daddy's anger, a thunderin' storm,
Left scars deeper than any coal mine's form.
Sixteen years, kicked out in the cold,
These Kentucky hollers, stories untold.
Broken arm, achin' bone and all,
But this rusted guitar, answered my call.
(Bridge)
Found solace in the strings, a mournful cry,
Echoin' the pain I couldn't deny.
Each note a whisper, a prayer sent high,
To the mountain's spirit, beneath the sky.
(Chorus)
Old man mountain, he don't speak a word,
But lessons learned, ain't never heard
In no dusty book or preacher's plea,
Just the wind's sigh in the old oak tree.
Truth ain't found in the city's glare,
It's here in the hollers, hangin' in the air.
(Outro)
Yeah, hangin' in the air, like the mountain mist,
A quiet knowin', that can't be missed.
Whispers from the hemlock, soft and low,
The mountain's wisdom, helpin' me grow...

shadows_holler.title: Shadow’s Holler
shadows_holler.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
In the hollow where the river bends,
A whisper fights the wind’s old trends.
It claws at the silence, sharp as a knife,
Beggin’ to sing, but it fears the light.
(Pre-Chorus)
The crows keep circlin’, they know my name,
Callin’ me out, but I dodge the flame.
(Chorus)
Shadow’s holler, screamin’ through the pines,
Carries my truth, where the moonlight shines.
It roars in the dark, but it hides from the day,
Shadow’s holler, got too much to say.
(Verse 2)
There’s a fire in the valley, burnin’ deep and low,
Words carved in my bones, that the river knows.
They churn like a current, wild and untamed,
But the spotlight’s a hunter, and I’m the game.
(Pre-Chorus)
Those black wings hover, they won’t let me be,
Urgin’ me loud, but I long to stay free.
(Chorus)
Shadow’s holler, screamin’ through the pines,
Carries my truth, where the moonlight shines.
It roars in the dark, but it hides from the day,
Shadow’s holler, got too much to say.
(Bridge)
I’ve seen the stage’s glow, a siren’s call,
Promisin’ glory, but it takes it all.
Yet the echo in my chest, it won’t stay still,
Like a ghost in the canyon, it’s hauntin’ me still.
(Chorus)
Shadow’s holler, screamin’ through the pines,
Carries my truth, where the moonlight shines.
It roars in the dark, but it hides from the day,
Shadow’s holler, got too much to say.
(Outro)
So I’ll sing to the shadows, where the wild things roam,
Let the river carry my heart back home.
In the quiet of the night, my truth’ll still fly,
Shadow’s holler, under a lonesome sky.
Yeah, shadow’s holler… forever I’ll hide.
Vibe: The song feels like a late-night confession in a pine forest, balancing the songwriter’s hidden truth with a universal yearning for expression. It’s introspective yet anthemic, fitting for both a dive bar and a festival stage. Performance: Picture the rugged artist in a flannel, strumming under stage lights with a band (acoustic, electric, pedal steel, banjo). The chorus invites quiet singalongs, and the bridge offers a raw, spotlight moment. For TikTok or busking, an acoustic version would emphasize the guitar’s twang and the vocals’ grit. Appeal: The allegorical storytelling and emotional depth resonate with country purists, while the melody and production could catch mainstream ears, potentially climbing charts or going viral on social media.
Sounds Like
A mid-tempo outlaw country anthem with a brooding, soulful edge, blending gritty authenticity with mainstream polish for radio and festival appeal. Anchored by a twangy acoustic guitar’s rhythmic strum and a haunting electric guitar riff, the track pulses with a steady kick drum and a deep, rolling bassline. A mournful pedal steel weaves through the verses, while subtle banjo plucks and a distant harmonica wail in the bridge add rural depth. The vocal delivery is raw, emotive, and slightly weathered, with conversational phrasing and soaring harmonies that lift the chorus into an anthemic cry. The tone is introspective, yearning, and allegorical, evoking a lone songwriter wrestling with his truth under a moonlit pine forest, perfect for a modern country playlist, a cinematic drama, or a heartfelt live performance.

canyons_cry.title: Canyon’s Cry
canyons_cry.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
There’s a storm in the canyon, tearin’ through my bones,
Thunder’s got my secrets, carved in jagged stones.
It howls to break the silence, begs to shake the sky,
But the sun’s a ruthless witness, and I’m scared to fly.
(Pre-Chorus)
The wildfire’s callin’, it won’t let me hide,
Ragin’ for the truth, burnin’ deep inside.
(Chorus)
Canyon’s cry, roarin’ through the night,
Screamin’ all my pain, in a blaze of light.
It’s wild, it’s fierce, gonna lift me high,
Canyon’s cry, born to defy!
(Verse 2)
I’ve danced with desert shadows, where the vultures soar,
Clutchin’ truths too heavy, that I can’t ignore.
They claw to reach the heavens, like a river’s flood,
But the spotlight’s a vulture, circlin’ for my blood.
(Pre-Chorus)
The lightning’s pushin’, it won’t let me stay,
Urgin’ me to holler, chase the dark away.
(Chorus)
Canyon’s cry, roarin’ through the night,
Screamin’ all my pain, in a blaze of light.
It’s wild, it’s fierce, gonna lift me high,
Canyon’s cry, born to defy!
(Bridge)
I’ve seen the valley’s altar, where the brave ones fall,
Heard the siren’s promise, but it steals it all.
Yet this fire in my veins, it’s a rebel’s spark,
Gonna shout my soul, tear the silence apart!
(Chorus)
Canyon’s cry, roarin’ through the night,
Screamin’ all my pain, in a blaze of light.
It’s wild, it’s fierce, gonna lift me high,
Canyon’s cry, born to defy!
(Outro)
So I’ll ride this storm, where the wild winds wail,
Let the canyon carry my truth’s old tale.
With the stars as my witness, I’ll set my pain free,
Canyon’s cry… it’s livin’ in me.
Yeah, canyon’s cry! (Raise it to the sky!)
Livin’ in me.
Vibe: The song feels like a thunderstorm in a desert canyon, with the narrator’s pain transforming into a defiant, uplifting cry. It’s intense enough for outlaw fans but anthemic for mainstream crowds, ideal for a festival climax or a movie’s triumphant moment. Performance: Picture the artist in a leather jacket, commanding a stage with a band (electric guitar, banjo, pedal steel, fiddle). The chorus sparks crowd chants, and the bridge could feature a dramatic guitar solo or vocal wail. For TikTok/busking, an acoustic version would rely on fierce strumming and raw vocals. Appeal: The blend of pain and empowerment, plus the driving energy, could make it a chart-climber or social media hit, resonating with listeners seeking catharsis.
Sounds Like
Full Band/Studio: The polished production amplifies the song’s “raise you up” energy with a full ensemble (electric guitar, pedal steel, banjo, fiddle, drums), making it a radio-ready anthem with outlaw grit, ideal for a festival or soundtrack. Acoustic/Live/Busking: Stripped to a single acoustic guitar, the raw vocals and rhythmic strumming preserve the song’s intensity and pain, perfect for an intimate TikTok live stream or a Nashville street corner, where the allegorical lyrics shine.

tumbleweed_promises.title: Tumbleweed Promises
tumbleweed_promises.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
I left my heart in a diner, on a napkin stained with wine,
Scribbled sweet nothins’, swore I’d make you mine.
But the road’s a jealous lover, she don’t let me stay,
Now those vows are driftin’, like tumbleweeds away.
(Pre-Chorus)
Every mile I travel, I’m chasin’ what I lost,
Payin’ for my freedom, but damn, what a cost.
(Chorus)
Tumbleweed promises, rollin’ through my mind,
Words I meant to keep, but left ‘em all behind.
They scatter in the wind, where the wild hearts roam,
Tumbleweed promises, never find a home.
(Verse 2)
Your laughter haunts the radio, in the static’s hum,
Singin’ ‘bout forever, but forever never comes.
I pass ghost-town motels, with their busted neon signs,
Wonderin’ if you’re out there, still callin’ me “mine.”
(Pre-Chorus)
This guitar’s my preacher, strummin’ out my truth,
Carvin’ out redemption, from the sins of my youth.
(Chorus)
Tumbleweed promises, rollin’ through my mind,
Words I meant to keep, but left ‘em all behind.
They scatter in the wind, where the wild hearts roam,
Tumbleweed promises, never find a home.
(Bridge)
I’ve loved in smoky barrooms, I’ve knelt in desert rain,
Swore I’d be your shelter, but I brought you pain.
Yet somewhere in this dust, there’s a spark that won’t fade,
A tumbleweed promise, that I’ll keep someday.
(Chorus)
Tumbleweed promises, rollin’ through my mind,
Words I meant to keep, but left ‘em all behind.
They scatter in the wind, where the wild hearts roam,
Tumbleweed promises, never find a home.
(Outro)
So I’ll ride these endless highways, with a bottle and a song,
Hopin’ you’re still waitin’, though I’ve been gone too long.
Till I find my way back, or the stars call me on,
Tumbleweed promises… keep rollin’ along.
Yeah, keep rollin’ along. (Tumbleweed dreams.)
Rollin’ along.
Vibe: The song feels like a late-night drive through a desert, with the narrator grappling with his transient life and lingering hope. It’s less intense than "Reaper" but equally compelling, with a balance of grit and melody. Performance: Picture the same artist performing this in a dimly lit roadhouse or on a festival stage, strumming a worn guitar with a band (acoustic, electric, pedal steel, harmonica). The chorus invites quiet singalongs, and the bridge could feature a spotlight on the singer’s raw delivery. Imagery and Themes: Lyrics evoke rural, transient life (diners, highways, tumbleweeds) while touching on universal emotions (love, regret, hope), making it relatable yet authentically country.
Sounds Like
A soulful, mid-tempo outlaw country anthem with a reflective, road-worn vibe, blending gritty authenticity with radio-friendly hooks.

church_of_country.title: Church of Country
church_of_country.lyrics:
Verse 1
I hit the stage on red dirt, where the heartland’s callin’ me,
From dive bar smoke to stadiums, this is where I’m free.
Hank’s ghost in my guitar, Dolly’s shine in my soul,
Country’s fire in my bones, it’s the only life I know.

Pre-Chorus
Steel guitars are my pulpit, banjo’s my battle cry,
Every scar’s a song I sing, reachin’ for the sky.

Chorus
This is the Church of Country, where the faithful raise a spark,
Johnny’s growl, Shania’s strut, lightin’ up the dark.
Sing for Patsy, for Stapleton, let the fiddle break the chains,
Country’s pulse is beatin’ loud, runnin’ wild in our veins!

Verse 2
I’m singin’ Loretta’s truth, Willie’s ramblin’ road,
George Jones’ whiskey heartache, carryin’ the load.
From Waylon’s outlaw thunder to Miranda’s rebel flame,
Every note’s my hallelujah, country’s my true name.

Pre-Chorus
Boots stomp the rhythm, my voice’ll shake the ground,
In this Church of Country, salvation’s what I’ve found.

Chorus
This is the Church of Country, where the faithful raise a spark,
Johnny’s growl, Shania’s strut, lightin’ up the dark.
Sing for Patsy, for Stapleton, let the fiddle break the chains,
Country’s pulse is beatin’ loud, runnin’ wild in our veins!

Bridge
It’s a honky-tonk redemption, where the broken find their fight,
Cash’s truth, Kacey’s grace, guidin’ me through the night.
From backroad hymns to neon dreams, I’ll carry on the sound,
Country’s heart is mine to hold, forever glory-bound!

Final Chorus
This is the Church of Country, where the roots will never fade,
Loretta’s coal dust soul, Alan’s river escapade.
Raise a glass for every dreamer, let the banjo’s fire roar,
Country’s callin’ me to sing, now and evermore!

Outro
*(Fiddle tears the roof off, steel guitar screams)*
Church of Country, hear my voice, let the whole world know,
This is my salvation, where my rebel heart’ll go!
*(Pyro pops, crowd roars)*
Hallelujah, country soul, Alex takes the show!

workin_for_a_living.title: Workin' for a Living
workin_for_a_living.lyrics:
Verse 1
Dawn breaks hard, boots hit the ground,
Sweat’s my pay where the work is found.
No silver spoon, just a will to fight,
Pushin’ through the long days into the night.

Pre-Chorus
Blisters on my hands, fire in my chest,
Every drop of sweat’s a step toward the best.

Chorus
Workin’ for a livin’, sunup till the stars burn bright,
Rough hands, tired bones, holdin’ on with all my might.
Ain’t got much, but I got heart, a spark that won’t let go,
Workin’ for a livin’, buildin’ dreams from the ground below.

Verse 2
Fields of dust, factory’s hum,
Haulin’ loads till my body’s numb.
Every ache’s a badge, every scar’s a sign,
I’m carvin’ out a life that’s proud and mine.

Pre-Chorus
No shortcut’s callin’, no easy way,
Just the grind that shapes me, day by day.

Chorus
Workin’ for a livin’, sunup till the stars burn bright,
Rough hands, tired bones, holdin’ on with all my might.
Ain’t got much, but I got heart, a spark that won’t let go,
Workin’ for a livin’, buildin’ dreams from the ground below.

Bridge
Round the fire’s glow, we share the load,
Laughin’ through the hurt, on this long road.
For the ones who toil, for the ones who strive,
This song’s for the workers keepin’ hope alive.

Chorus
Workin’ for a livin’, sunup till the stars burn bright,
Rough hands, tired bones, holdin’ on with all my might.
Ain’t got much, but I got heart, a spark that won’t let go,
Workin’ for a livin’, buildin’ dreams from the ground below.

Outro
(Fiddle kicks, steady strum)
Workin’ for a livin’, that’s my truth, my fight,
From the break of dawn to the end of night.

wild_la.title: Wild LA
wild_la.lyrics:
Verse 1
I’m a red dirt drifter, boots scarred from the clay,
Dropped in this jungle they call LA.
Oat milk in my coffee? That ain’t milk, I reckon,
Oats don’t got nipples, y’all messin’ with my head, son.

Pre-Chorus
Kombucha flights and candles with a prayer,
Farmers market’s a circus, patchouli in the air.

Chorus
Wild LA, where the kale’s got a soul,
I’m a fish outta water, but I’m keepin’ my roll.
From raw almond jerky to goats in a sweater,
I’m laughin’ through the madness, this heart’s gettin’ better.
Grounded in the holler, but I’m ridin’ this wave,
Singin’ my truth in the heart of Wild LA!

Verse 2
Celery smoothies run eleven bucks a pop,
Mushrooms get a massage ‘fore they hit the shop.
Man bun’s pluckin’ banjo, bought it off the ‘net,
But them bruised-up apples? That’s the realest I’ve met.

Pre-Chorus
Charcoal lavender brew, moonlight in a glass,
I’m dodgin’ astral vibes, holdin’ onto my sass.

Chorus
Wild LA, where the kale’s got a soul,
I’m a fish outta water, but I’m keepin’ my roll.
From raw almond jerky to goats in a sweater,
I’m laughin’ through the madness, this heart’s gettin’ better.
Grounded in the holler, but I’m ridin’ this wave,
Singin’ my truth in the heart of Wild LA!

Bridge
Met a goat named Harold, sportin’ knitwear fine,
Chewin’ like a sage, got me losin’ my mind.
Shay’s wheezin’ laughter, says I’m too much sense,
But this crazy town’s spark’s breakin’ down my defense.

Chorus
Wild LA, where the kale’s got a soul,
I’m a fish outta water, but I’m keepin’ my roll.
From raw almond jerky to goats in a sweater,
I’m laughin’ through the madness, this heart’s gettin’ better.
Grounded in the holler, but I’m ridin’ this wave,
Singin’ my truth in the heart of Wild LA!

Outro
(Fiddle rips, upbeat strum)
Wild LA, with Harold’s sweater in view,
This red dirt boy’s found a home in the zoo.

coal_dust_sunrise.title: Coal Dust Sunrise
coal_dust_sunrise.lyrics:
Long shadows creep on the valley floor,
As the bleeding sky unveils what's in store.
A cold breath sighs through the hollows deep,
Where old dreams stir and new promises keep.
A shack stands weathered, a whisper of gray,
But a tender warmth chases shadows away.
A soft hymn rises on the morning's chill,
A silent plea, standing perfectly still.
(Pre-Chorus)
Beneath the grit, a spark ignites,
Chasing the ghosts of endless nights.
This ain't no Eden, raw and deep,
But promises the weary keep.
(Chorus)
These coal dust sunrises, they stain the peaks in gray,
But hope's true fire still finds a way, yeah, it always finds a way.
The tired earth groans, a haunting, low refrain,
Yet grit-worn hands find strength to rise and live again.
To rise and breathe again.
(Verse 2)
The earth gives freely, then demands its toll,
Each dawn a testament to body and soul.
Redemption's whisper in the morning's light,
A bruising struggle, a constant, inner fight.
A flicker of grace, a beacon in the night,
A stubborn promise burning ever so bright.
The scars remain, a map of every pain,
But the spirit's song, a fierce, unbroken strain.
(Pre-Chorus)
Beneath the grit, a spark ignites,
Chasing the ghosts of endless nights.
This ain't no Eden, raw and deep,
But promises the weary keep.
(Chorus)
These coal dust sunrises, they stain the peaks in gray,
But hope's true fire still finds a way, yeah, it always finds a way.
The tired earth groans, a haunting, low refrain,
Yet grit-worn hands find strength to rise and live again.
To rise and breathe again.
(Bridge)
The mountain stands, a titan through the years,
Swallowing hardship, conquering all fears.
This ain't the ending, just a beat in between,
A chance to reclaim, to heal, to be seen.
(Chorus)
These coal dust sunrises, they stain the peaks in gray,
But hope's true fire still finds a way, yeah, it always finds a way.
The tired earth groans, a haunting, low refrain,
Yet grit-worn hands find strength to rise and live again.
To rise and breathe again.
(Outro)
To rise and breathe again,
A coal dust sunrise, and we're all risin' again.

drivin_to_you.title: Drivin' to You
drivin_to_you.lyrics:
Verse 1
Kicked off from Kentucky, tires spinnin’ through the night,
Your dream’s in California, girl, I’m racin’ toward your light.
Tennessee’s hills are callin’, with their banjo serenade,
Arkansas’ muddy delta’s where your memory’s never strayed.

Pre-Chorus
Radio’s buzzin’, but your voice is my guide,
Every state’s a promise, I’m crossin’ the divide.

Chorus
From Texas to California, I’m ridin’ into LA!
Drivin’ to you, darlin’, no state’s too far away!
Oklahoma to Nevada, I’m burnin’ up the miles,
Sing it loud, I’m comin’ for your heart and your smile!
Your dream’s my compass, I’m chasin’ your glow,
From Texas to California, girl, here I go!

Verse 2
Oklahoma’s plains are screamin’, wind tearin’ at my soul,
Texas stars light the way, your face in their fiery roll.
Missouri’s rivers churn wild, reflectin’ your sweet spark,
New Mexico’s desert heat can’t stop this racin’ heart.

Pre-Chorus
Coffee’s cold as stone, but my heart’s runnin’ hot,
This highway’s my heartstring, tyin’ all I got.

Chorus
From Texas to California, I’m ridin’ into LA!
Drivin’ to you, darlin’, no state’s too far away!
Oklahoma to Nevada, I’m burnin’ up the miles,
Sing it loud, I’m comin’ for your heart and your smile!
Your dream’s my compass, I’m chasin’ your glow,
From Texas to California, girl, here I go!

Bridge
Colorado’s peaks stand tall, Arizona’s canyons wail,
Nevada’s neon flickers, but your love’s my holy grail.
I’d blaze through every state line, fight the wind and the storm,
For one night in your arms, keepin’ my heart warm.

Chorus
From Texas to California, I’m ridin’ into LA!
Drivin’ to you, darlin’, no state’s too far away!
Oklahoma to Nevada, I’m burnin’ up the miles,
Sing it loud, I’m comin’ for your heart and your smile!
Your dream’s my compass, I’m chasin’ your glow,
From Texas to California, girl, here I go!

Outro
From Texas to California, sunrise breakin’ through,
This road’s my love, and it’s leadin’ to you.

devil_came_back_for_georgia.title: Devil Came Back for Georgia
devil_came_back_for_georgia.lyrics:
The Devil Came Back to Georgia
The Devil came back to Georgia,
He was burnin’ for a second round.
That first defeat left his pride in heat,
And he craved that sultry sound.
He found her swayin’ by a riverside,
Under stars that pulsed with sin,
Her eyes like coals, she stirred his soul,
And he swore he’d win her grin.
“Well, darlin’, I’m back,” he purred with a leer,
“Got a new game to ignite.
You scorched me once, but I’m no dunce,
This time I’ll own the night.”
He flicked his tongue, let the shadows hum,
And the air grew thick with lust.
“I’ll raise the stakes, make no mistake,
This dance’ll turn you to dust.”
Georgia laughed, her voice like wine,
“Devil, you’re barkin’ up my tree.
You think you’re sly, but I’ll make you cry,
‘Cause this fire belongs to me.”
She stepped in close, her breath a tease,
Let her fingers graze his chest.
“Bring your best, I’ll do the rest,
And put your wicked heart to rest.”
Chorus:
Sparks on the river, flames in the dark,
Georgia’s got that untamed spark.
Velvet and venom, a dangerous game,
The Devil’s lost in Georgia’s flame.
The Devil moved with a serpent’s grace,
Every touch a fevered spell.
He wove his charm, thought he’d do no harm,
But Georgia knew his hell.
She matched his heat, step for step,
Her hips a taunting dare,
Each whispered word made his senses blur,
Till he was drowning in her stare.
When the dawn crept soft through the cypress shade,
The Devil knelt, undone.
Georgia smirked, her magic worked,
She’d played him ‘til she’d won.
“You thought you’d tame me, sweet Lucifer,
But I’m the queen of this domain.”
She blew a kiss, left him in bliss,
And sent him back to his pain.
Chorus:
Sparks on the river, flames in the dark,
Georgia’s got that untamed spark.
Velvet and venom, a dangerous game,
The Devil’s lost in Georgia’s flame.
Outro:
The Devil came back to Georgia,
But Georgia stole the crown.
She spun that sly ol’ sinner
And burned his kingdom down.

my_kentucky_heartbeat.title: My Kentucky Heartbeat
my_kentucky_heartbeat.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Sunrise paints these Blue Ridge Mountains, but I'm already caked in mine grime
Another shift done, countin' pennies, losin' track of time.
This old pickup's my four walls now, under the Kentucky moon so wide
But thinkin' of your West Coast smile, girl, eases the ache inside.
(Chorus)
Hey, Shay, my Kentucky Heartbeat, my steady ground so true,
Miles can't change this rhythm I only find in you.
Every sunrise I fight for, every dollar I make,
Is for your California dream, no matter what it takes.
(Verse 2)
Remember Blackberry Creek, dust devils dancin' in the summer heat?
Felt like magic then, your hand in mine, oh, bitter and so sweet.
Now your picture on the dash, it guides me through the dark and lonely road
Helps me carry every burden, helps me lift this heavy load.
(Chorus)
Hey, Shay, my Kentucky Heartbeat, my steady ground so true,
Miles can't change this rhythm I only find in you.
Every sunrise I fight for, every dollar I make,
Is for your California dream, no matter what it takes.
(Bridge)
These calloused hands have known the sting of cold and burnin' steel
Played a rusted, found guitar, makin' all this heartache real.
But you heard the truth within the noise, a song beneath the pain
My Shay Bear, your belief in me, it washes off the stains.
(Chorus)
Hey, Shay, my Kentucky Heartbeat, my steady ground so true,
Miles can't change this rhythm I only find in you.
Every sunrise I fight for, every dollar I make,
Is for your California dream, no matter what it takes.
(Outro)
Yeah, my Kentucky Heartbeat, thumpin' just for you, Shay Bear. 
More than just some words, girl, this is my earnest prayer.
My truth, my song, for you

going_viral.title: Going Viral
going_viral.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Started with some coffee, or what they call it here,
Talkin' 'bout oat nipples, made Shay Bear grin ear to ear.
Then a goat in a sweater, name of Harold, if you please,
Had me on the pavement, laughin' till I couldn't breathe.
Moonbeam had a guitar, hangin' like a piece of art,
Said it needed playin', right from my Kentucky heart.
(Chorus)
Now they say I'm goin' viral, whatever that might mean,
Little screens all lit up, the craziest damn thing I've seen.
Singin' 'bout sad porridge and Harold in his Sunday best,
Just a red dirt drifter puttin' feelings to the test,
Out here in this LA sun, ain't like no place I know,
Wonderin' how a whisper turned into a picture show.
(Verse 2)
Jumped up on a table, sang about this crazy town,
The words just came on out, as the folks all gathered 'round.
Then I sang 'bout hardship, and that guitar from the trash,
Felt the whole world listen, saw the tears begin to splash.
Shay was lookin' prouder than I'd ever seen her look,
Like she knew these city folks would read me like a book.
(Chorus)
Now they say I'm goin' viral, whatever that might mean,
Little screens all lit up, the craziest damn thing I've seen.
Singin' 'bout sad porridge and Harold in his Sunday best,
Just a red dirt drifter puttin' feelings to the test,
Out here in this LA sun, ain't like no place I know,
Wonderin' how a whisper turned into a picture show.
(Bridge)
Ain't never chased no spotlight, ain't my kind of game,
Just sing my truth out quiet, whisper Shay Bear's name.
But if my rusty-string stories, 'bout the hurt and hope I've known,
Can make a stranger out there feel a little less alone...
Well, maybe there's a reason this wild seed was sown.
(Chorus)
Now they say I'm goin' viral, whatever that might mean,
Little screens all lit up, the craziest damn thing I've seen.
Singin' 'bout sad porridge and Harold in his Sunday best,
Just a red dirt drifter puttin' feelings to the test,
Out here in this LA sun, ain't like no place I know,
Wonderin' how a whisper turned into a picture show.
(Outro)
Yeah, a picture show... full of folks I've never met.
Still don't get this "viral," ain't quite figured it out yet.
Just got my girl, my guitar... and I guess Harold the goat.
(Guitar fades out with a soft, questioning strum)

through_the_silence.title: Through the Silence
through_the_silence.lyrics:
Verse 1:
Born in the shadow of a rusted cage,
Coal dust scars and a heart’s old rage.
Words stayed locked where the hurt runs deep,
Whispers in the dark were mine to keep.
Chorus:
You gotta walk through silence to sing the truth,
Feel the ache in your bones, let it carve your youth.
Every scar’s a note, every wound’s a song,
Through the silence, I found where I belong.
Verse 2:
Nights on the mountain, just me and the wind,
Strummed my pain where the pines don’t end.
Each string I broke was a chain let go,
Truth came alive where the quiet grows.
Chorus:
You gotta walk through silence to sing the truth,
Feel the ache in your bones, let it carve your youth.
Every scar’s a note, every wound’s a song,
Through the silence, I found where I belong.
Bridge:
No crowd, no stage, just a heart laid bare,
Sang to the stars ‘cause they always cared.
The hurt runs deep, but the truth runs free,
Silence taught the song that’s savin’ me.
Chorus:
You gotta walk through silence to sing the truth,
Feel the ache in your bones, let it carve your youth.
Every scar’s a note, every wound’s a song,
Through the silence, I found where I belong.
Outro:
Now I sing my truth, let the echoes fly,
Born in the silence ‘neath a Kentucky sky.
You gotta walk through silence, let it break you loose,
To find the song that’s livin’ in your truth.

forever_happy.title: Forever Happy
forever_happy.lyrics:
Verse 1:
Stepped to the edge where the blue runs free,
Waves hit my heart like a melody.
Sun’s shinin’ down, got a brand-new view,
Every moment’s brighter ‘cause I’m here with you.
Chorus:
Watchin’ forever and comin’ away happy,
Soul’s on fire, and my heart’s snappin’ snappy.
Ocean’s singin’, and I’m feelin’ alive,
Watchin’ forever, gonna thrive, gonna thrive!
Verse 2:
Kick off my boots, let the sand take hold,
Your smile’s the spark that’s worth more than gold.
Laughin’ in the breeze, we’re a carefree song,
Dancin’ with the waves, where we both belong.
Chorus:
Watchin’ forever and comin’ away happy,
Soul’s on fire, and my heart’s snappin’ snappy.
Ocean’s singin’, and I’m feelin’ alive,
Watchin’ forever, gonna thrive, gonna thrive!
Bridge:
Ain’t no worries when the tide rolls in,
Every heartbeat’s where our story begins.
Raise a glass to the sky, let the good times roll,
This kinda joy’s what we’re livin’ for.
Chorus:
Watchin’ forever and comin’ away happy,
Soul’s on fire, and my heart’s snappin’ snappy.
Ocean’s singin’, and I’m feelin’ alive,
Watchin’ forever, gonna thrive, gonna thrive!
Outro:
Yeah, watchin’ forever with a grin ear to ear,
Got this moment, and I’m holdin’ it near.
Comin’ away happy, gonna shout to the sky,
Watchin’ forever, we’ll never say goodbye!

keep_singin_on.title: Keep Singin’ On
keep_singin_on.lyrics:
Verse 1:
Came to this town with a song in my heart,
Voice full of dreams, but the world’s played hard.
Waitin’ on tables, sweepin’ floors till dawn,
Holdin’ to hope when the money’s all gone.
Chorus:
Keep singin’ on, let the truth ring true,
Every note’s a fight for the life I pursue.
Through the ache and the doubt, I’ll still raise my song,
Heart’s still burnin’, so I keep singin’ on.
Verse 2:
Mama’s voice echoes, said I’d shine someday,
But she’s gone to glory, and I’m still findin’ my way.
This old guitar’s my only friend some nights,
Singin’ to shadows, chasin’ stage lights.
Chorus:
Keep singin’ on, let the truth ring true,
Every note’s a fight for the life I pursue.
Through the ache and the doubt, I’ll still raise my song,
Heart’s still burnin’, so I keep singin’ on.
Bridge:
Bills stack high, and the dreams wear thin,
But my soul’s got a fire that won’t give in.
Every scar’s a story, every tear’s a call,
I’ll sing through the silence till I’ve given it all.
Chorus:
Keep singin’ on, let the truth ring true,
Every note’s a fight for the life I pursue.
Through the ache and the doubt, I’ll still raise my song,
Heart’s still burnin’, so I keep singin’ on.
Outro:
So here’s my voice, let it carry me home,
Through empty rooms where my dreams still roam.
No matter how heavy, I’ll carry this dawn,
With love in my heart, I keep singin’ on.

going_viral_2.title: Going Viral
going_viral_2.lyrics:
Verse 1
Up on the bluff where the wild winds sing,
Strummed my old guitar, let my heartstrings ring.
Sang to the stars, just me and the night,
Never thought my songs would catch fire online.

Chorus
Now they say I’m goin’ viral, whatever that might mean,
Little screens all lit up, craziest thing I’ve seen!
Singin’ ‘bout Georgia and the Devil’s dance,
Just a bluff-top dreamer takin’ one wild chance!

Verse 2
Crowd packed tight at the town’s old bar,
Hollered I’d get nekked, pushed it just too far.
Fiddle screamed hot, ‘bout the Devil and the deal,
Whole place roared, felt the floorboards reel.

Chorus
Now they say I’m goin’ viral, whatever that might mean,
Little screens all lit up, craziest thing I’ve seen!
Singin’ ‘bout Georgia and the Devil’s dance,
Just a bluff-top dreamer takin’ one wild chance!

Bridge
Ain’t no stage I planned, just truth in my soul,
Songs from the heart made the whole world roll.
From a lonesome wind to a million views,
Guess my voice sparked fire in folks’ old boots!

Chorus
Now they say I’m goin’ viral, whatever that might mean,
Little screens all lit up, craziest thing I’ve seen!
Singin’ ‘bout Georgia and the Devil’s dance,
Just a bluff-top dreamer takin’ one wild chance!

Outro
(Claps, hollers, fiddle wails)
Yeah, goin’ viral, still don’t know the score,
Just me and my songs, and that bluff’s wild roar!

through_the_silence_2.title: Through the Silence
through_the_silence_2.lyrics:
Verse 1:
Born in the shadow of a rusted cage,
Coal dust scars and a heart’s old rage.
Words stayed locked where the hurt runs deep,
Whispers in the dark were mine to keep.
Chorus:
You gotta walk through silence to sing the truth,
Feel the ache in your bones, let it carve your youth.
Every scar’s a note, every wound’s a song,
Through the silence, I found where I belong.
Verse 2:
Nights on the mountain, just me and the wind,
Strummed my pain where the pines don’t end.
Each string I broke was a chain let go,
Truth came alive where the quiet grows.
Chorus:
You gotta walk through silence to sing the truth,
Feel the ache in your bones, let it carve your youth.
Every scar’s a note, every wound’s a song,
Through the silence, I found where I belong.
Bridge:
No crowd, no stage, just a heart laid bare,
Sang to the stars ‘cause they always cared.
The hurt runs deep, but the truth runs free,
Silence taught the song that’s savin’ me.
Chorus:
You gotta walk through silence to sing the truth,
Feel the ache in your bones, let it carve your youth.
Every scar’s a note, every wound’s a song,
Through the silence, I found where I belong.
Outro:
Now I sing my truth, let the echoes fly,
Born in the silence ‘neath a Kentucky sky.
You gotta walk through silence, let it break you loose,
To find the song that’s livin’ in your truth.

the_songs_that_saved_me.title: The Songs That Saved Me
the_songs_that_saved_me.lyrics:
Verse 1
In a trailer’s shadow, where the silence screamed,
Found a rusted guitar, chased a broken dream.
Johnny’s voice of hurt cut through my pain,
Waylon’s rebel soul kept me sane.

Chorus
Songs that saved me, pullin’ me through,
Truth in the darkness, love that’s true.
From the grave’s cold call to a heart’s soft plea,
These old songs, they’re savin’ me.

Verse 2
Stapleton’s gravel wrapped my scars in grace,
Childers sang the hills where I found my place.
Adele’s fire burned my doubts away,
Each note a light in my lonesome day.

Chorus
Songs that saved me, pullin’ me through,
Truth in the darkness, love that’s true.
From the grave’s cold call to a heart’s soft plea,
These old songs, they’re savin’ me.

Bridge
“Hurt” taught me wounds can sing out loud,
“Cover Me Up” showed love’s the proudest sound.
“O Death” whispered life’s a fleeting flame,
Their truths carved my heart, gave me my name.

Chorus
Songs that saved me, pullin’ me through,
Truth in the darkness, love that’s true.
From the grave’s cold call to a heart’s soft plea,
These old songs, they’re savin’ me.

Outro
Now I strum my truth ‘neath a lonesome sky,
Carryin’ their echoes till the day I die.
Through the pain and love, their voices I see,
These old songs, forever savin’ me.

empty_seat.title: Empty Seat
empty_seat.lyrics:
Verse 1

Every mornin’ she’d slip through that diner door,

Same old booth, coffee black, nothin’ more.

Never spoke, just stared where the shadows creep,

Today her seat’s empty, and the silence cuts deep.

Chorus

Oh, the empty seat, where’d she go?

Carried her story where nobody knows.

A ghost in the booth, left a chill in the air,

Empty seat’s whisperin’, she ain’t there.

Verse 2

Worn-out coat, eyes like a lonesome rain,

No one asked her story, not even her name.

Waitress hums soft, but the counter feels wrong,

Her shadow’s gone quiet, where it used to belong.

Chorus

Oh, the empty seat, where’d she go?

Carried her story where nobody knows.

A ghost in the booth, left a chill in the air,

Empty seat’s whisperin’, she ain’t there.

Bridge

Was she runnin’ from hurt, or chasin’ a dream?

Lost in the cracks of a life’s frayed seam.

That booth holds her echo, a truth left unsaid,

A stranger’s gone missin’, but she ain’t dead.

Chorus

Oh, the empty seat, where’d she go?

Carried her story where nobody knows.

A ghost in the booth, left a chill in the air,

Empty seat’s whisperin’, she ain’t there.

Outro

In a small-town diner, ‘neath the hum of the light,

Her seat stays empty, through the long, lonesome night.

coal_dust_on_the_lamb.title: Coal Dust on the Lamb
coal_dust_on_the_lamb.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Sixteen summers bleedin' into fall,
Daddy's shadow stretched across the wall.
His words like whiskey, burnin' down my throat,
Kicked me out to wander, wearin' a thin coat.
Pikeville hollers echoed with my shame,
Innocence a flicker, dyin' in the flame.

(Verse 2)
Found a floor to sleep on, kindness in a stranger's eye,
But the mountain cold seeped in, beneath a starless sky.
Traded school books for a pick and shovel's weight,
Coal dust settled on my dreams, sealin' up their fate.
This broken arm, a constant ache, a twisted memory,
Of a boy who used to dream beneath a dogwood tree.

(Chorus)
Coal dust on the lamb, a stain that won't come clean,
Lost my way back home, a forgotten, faded scene.
These coal-stained hands, they hold the weight of sin,
Prayin' for redemption, hopin' God lets me in.

(Verse 3)
Sunrise paints the mountain ridge, a fiery, bloody hue,
Another day of breakin' back, another debt to accrue.
The fields stretch out before me, endless rows of green,
But all I see is darkness, a fractured, broken scene.
This ain't the life I pictured,  beneath the mountain's gaze,
Just a broken boy, lost in a lonely, hazy maze.

(Bridge)
Mama's hymnals echo, a whisper in the wind,
A memory of comfort, a peace I can't pretend.
Will I ever feel that grace again, that gentle, lovin' hand?
Or am I destined to wander, a ghost in this promised land?

(Chorus)
Coal dust on the lamb, a stain that won't come clean,
Lost my way back home, a forgotten, faded scene.
These coal-stained hands, they hold the weight of sin,
Prayin' for redemption, hopin' God lets me in.

(Outro)
Lord, have mercy, on this coal-stained soul,
Lead me back to the fold, make me whole. 
Make me whole.

the_road_to_nashville.title: The Road to Nashville
the_road_to_nashville.lyrics:
Verse 1
Got a beat-up truck and a guitar case,
Dreams burnin’ hotter than a summer’s blaze.
Leavin’ small-town dust in my rearview glow,
Headed where the neon lights call my soul.

Chorus
On the road to Nashville, sing it loud and free!
Chasin’ stars and honky-tonks, where I’m meant to be!
From the backroads to the bright lights, feel the thrill,
On the road to Nashville, I’m climbin’ that hill!

Verse 2
Sweet tea sippin’, boots tappin’ the floor,
Singin’ my heart out, knockin’ on doors.
Every mile’s a story, every note’s a fight,
Southern grit’s pushin’ me through the night.

Chorus
On the road to Nashville, sing it loud and free!
Chasin’ stars and honky-tonks, where I’m meant to be!
From the backroads to the bright lights, feel the thrill,
On the road to Nashville, I’m climbin’ that hill!

Bridge
Raise a bottle, let the fiddle wail,
Every dreamer’s got a tale to tell!
With a song in my soul and fire in my veins,
Nashville’s callin’, breakin’ all my chains!

Chorus
On the road to Nashville, sing it loud and free!
Chasin’ stars and honky-tonks, where I’m meant to be!
From the backroads to the bright lights, feel the thrill,
On the road to Nashville, I’m climbin’ that hill!

Outro
(Claps, hollers, banjo rolls)
On the road to Nashville, never standin’ still,
Sing it proud, keep pushin’, got a dream to fill!
From the heartland to the stage, I’m risin’ high,
On the road to Nashville, reachin’ for the sky!

roots_torn_slow.title: Roots Torn Slow
roots_torn_slow.lyrics:
Some folks leave like a gust through the pines,
Fast and loud, gone before the night’s decline.
But you left like roots ripped from the ground,
Slow and breakin’, didn’t make a sound.
I stood there watchin’, my heart in my hands,
Pieces of me scattered ‘cross this lonesome land.
(Pre-Chorus)
Every step feels like I’m circlin’ a scar,
A hollow where you were, where you tore me apart.
(Chorus)
Roots torn slow, they don’t just fade away,
They leave a hole that haunts me every day.
I walk like I’m growin’ ‘round the pain,
Plantin’ flowers in the dirt where you remained.
They bloom deeper, they know what I’ve lost,
They choose sunlight, no matter the cost.
(Verse 2)
I used to think love was a fire that burned,
But yours was a weight, a lesson I learned.
Each crack in my soul, it taught me to fight,
To find my own spark in the cold, endless night.
Now I’m sowin’ seeds where the shadows still creep,
Buildin’ a garden from the hurt runnin’ deep.
(Pre-Chorus)
Every bloom’s a battle, every petal’s a prayer,
Proof I’m still standin’, though you ain’t there.
(Chorus)
Roots torn slow, they don’t just fade away,
They leave a hole that haunts me every day.
I walk like I’m growin’ ‘round the pain,
Plantin’ flowers in the dirt where you remained.
They bloom deeper, they know what I’ve lost,
They choose sunlight, no matter the cost.
(Bridge)
I ain’t the girl you left in the dust,
My heart’s got thorns now, forged from the rust.
But these hands still dig, they still reach for the sky,
Turnin’ tears into roses that won’t ever die.
Your leavin’ broke me, but it made me whole,
I found my roots in this stubborn soul.
(Chorus)
Roots torn slow, they don’t just fade away,
They leave a hole that haunts me every day.
I walk like I’m growin’ ‘round the pain,
Plantin’ flowers in the dirt where you remained.
They bloom deeper, they know what I’ve lost,
They choose sunlight, no matter the cost.
(Outro)
Some leave like wind, but you left like stone,
Tore out my roots, but I’m growin’ my own.
These flowers I plant, they’re my heart’s quiet vow,
They bloom deeper… and I’m stronger now.

keep_singing_on.title: Keep Singing On
keep_singing_on.lyrics:
Verse 1:
Came to this town with a song in my heart,
Voice full of dreams, but the world’s played hard.
Waitin’ on tables, sweepin’ floors till dawn,
Holdin’ to hope when the money’s all gone.

Chorus:
Keep singin’ on, let the truth ring true,
Every note’s a fight for the life I pursue.
Through the ache and the doubt, I’ll still raise my song,
Heart’s still burnin’, so I keep singin’ on.

Verse 2:
Mama’s voice echoes, said I’d shine someday,
But she’s gone to glory, and I’m still findin’ my way.
This old guitar’s my only friend some nights,
Singin’ to shadows, chasin’ stage lights.

Chorus:
Keep singin’ on, let the truth ring true,
Every note’s a fight for the life I pursue.
Through the ache and the doubt, I’ll still raise my song,
Heart’s still burnin’, so I keep singin’ on.

Bridge:
Bills stack high, and the dreams wear thin,
But my soul’s got a fire that won’t give in.
Every scar’s a story, every tear’s a call,
I’ll sing through the silence till I’ve given it all.

Chorus:
Keep singin’ on, let the truth ring true,
Every note’s a fight for the life I pursue.
Through the ache and the doubt, I’ll still raise my song,
Heart’s still burnin’, so I keep singin’ on.

Outro:
So here’s my voice, let it carry me home,
Through empty rooms where my dreams still roam.
No matter how heavy, I’ll carry this dawn,
With love in my heart, I keep singin’ on.

country_city_girl.title: Country City Girl
country_city_girl.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Left the dirt roads in the dust, for streets all shiny bright,
Swapped the quiet starry evenings for the buzz of city nights.
Packed her dreams up in a suitcase, and her mama's good advice,
Said, "I'm gonna make it out there, gonna roll them city dice!"

(Chorus)
She's got that hometown heart in the big city glow,
Learnin' new tricks, watchin' her confidence grow!
Same sweet girl, with a brand new shine,
That country-city girl, and she's all mine! (Yeah, she's all mine!)

(Verse 2)
Still knows how to bake a pie that’ll make you ask for more,
Now she’s charmin' all the big shots, knockin' right on fortune's door.
Takes that good ol' country common sense, gives it a big city spin,
Makes 'em wonder how a country girl just always seems to win!

(Chorus)
She's got that hometown heart in the big city glow,
Learnin' new tricks, watchin' her confidence grow!
Same sweet girl, with a brand new shine,
That country-city girl, and she's all mine! (Yeah, she's all mine!)

(Guitar/Fiddle Solo – Simple, catchy, and upbeat. Easy to hum along to.)

(Bridge)
Those city lights can't hide her smile, I see it in my mind,
She's the best of both them places, truly one of a special kind.
And I’m prouder than a rooster, crowin' loud at break of day,
My country girl's a-takin' on the world, and lightin' up the way!

(Chorus)
She's got that hometown heart in the big city glow,
Learnin' new tricks, watchin' her confidence grow!
Same sweet girl, with a brand new shine,
That country-city girl, and she's all mine! (Yeah, she's all mine!)

(Outro)
In the big city glow!
Watch her go, go, go!
That country-city girl o' mine!

that_good_ol_90s_country.title: That Good Old 90s Country
that_good_ol_90s_country.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
1992, dirt roads and FM gold
George Strait on the radio, stories being told
Levi's worn thin, boots kicked up high
Chattahoochee memories under Georgia sky
[Verse 2]
Garth was king and Faith was rising
Brooks & Dunn kept dance floors flying
Shania showed us what a woman feels
When country music still had steel
[Chorus]
They don't make 'em like they did back then
When three chords and truth was more than just pretend
No Auto-Tune, no drum machines
Just real songs about real dreams
That good ol' 90s country
[Bridge]
Alan Jackson taught us how to live
Travis Tritt showed what love could give
And every small-town Friday night
Was pure country done just right
[Chorus]
They don't make 'em like they did back then
When three chords and truth was more than just pretend
No Auto-Tune, no drum machines
Just real songs about real dreams
That good ol' 90s country
[Outro]
Yeah, that good ol' 90s country
When the music meant something true
That good ol' 90s country
Still running straight through my blood
That good ol' 90s country

gimme_that_black_brew.title: Gimme That Black Brew
gimme_that_black_brew.lyrics:
Gimme That Black Brew

**Verse 1**  
Walked into a shop, thought I’d get a cup,  
But they’re pushin’ green tea dust, and I’m all fed up.  
Matcha this, oat milk that, five bucks for a sip,  
Tastes like lawn clippings, burns a hole in my grip.  

**Chorus**  
Gimme that black brew, punch me as it goes down!  
Strong like a mule kick, wake this small-town clown!  
No fads, no frills, just coffee dark and true,  
Gimme that black brew, that’s what’ll get me through!  

**Verse 2**  
Barista’s talkin’ foam art, syrups by the score,  
I just want a jolt, not a fancy pour.  
Oat milk’s got no nipples, that ain’t no cow’s delight,  
Need a brew to shake me, keep me workin’ till the night.  

**Chorus**  
Gimme that black brew, punch me as it goes down!  
Strong like a mule kick, wake this small-town clown!  
No fads, no frills, just coffee dark and true,  
Gimme that black brew, that’s what’ll get me through!  

**Bridge**  
Raise a mug to the grind, to the simple and plain,  
No hipster nonsense cloggin’ up my brain!  
Just boil it thick, let it scald my soul,  
Black brew’s the fire that makes me whole!  

**Chorus**  
Gimme that black brew, punch me as it goes down!  
Strong like a mule kick, wake this small-town clown!  
No fads, no frills, just coffee dark and true,  
Gimme that black brew, that’s what’ll get me through!  

**Outro**  
(Claps, hollers, banjo twang)  
Gimme that black brew, none of that LA fake,  
Pour it strong, keep me wide awake!

soul_food.title: Soul Food
soul_food.lyrics:
Verse 1
Walked through the door, grease poppin’ in the air,
Cornbread steamin’, love’s everywhere.
Mama’s in the kitchen, stirrin’ up a spell,
Plates piled high, where the heart can dwell.

Chorus
Soul food, oh, it’s lard and grace!
Fills my mind, my soul, my face!
From the skillet to the heart, it’s healin’ me whole,
Soul food, feedin’ body and soul!

Verse 2
Collard greens simmer, black-eyed peas sing,
Every bite’s a prayer, makes the spirit swing.
Round that table, laughin’, stories unfold,
Warmin’ up the weary, worth more than gold.

Chorus
Soul food, oh, it’s lard and grace!
Fills my mind, my soul, my face!
From the skillet to the heart, it’s healin’ me whole,
Soul food, feedin’ body and soul!

Bridge
Pass the biscuits, pour the gravy high,
Feel the love that lifts you to the sky!
In this sacred spot, where the good times roll,
Lard and grace gonna save your soul!

Chorus
Soul food, oh, it’s lard and grace!
Fills my mind, my soul, my face!
From the skillet to the heart, it’s healin’ me whole,
Soul food, feedin’ body and soul!

Outro
(Claps, hollers, gospel hum)
Soul food, yeah, it’s where I’m found,
Lard and grace, in that holy ground!

miles_of_sorrow.title: Miles of Sorrow
miles_of_sorrow.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Sunrise paints the cotton fields, another day begins
But the light don't shine so bright, since your love went on the winds
We built a life on promises, beneath a Georgia moon
But your city dreams called louder, than my love could ever croon
(Chorus)
Miles of sorrow stretch between us, a highway paved with tears
Each mile a memory fading, swallowed by the passing years
We said forever, honey, but forever couldn't hold
Against the pull of distance, a story left untold
(Verse 2)
Remember dancin' in the hayloft, beneath the summer stars?
Your laughter like a mockingbird, escaping rusty bars
We swore our love was stronger, than any earthly pain
But the miles kept piling higher, a relentless, driving rain
(Chorus)
Miles of sorrow stretch between us, a highway paved with tears
Each mile a memory fading, swallowed by the passing years
We said forever, honey, but forever couldn't hold
Against the pull of distance, a story left untold
(Bridge)
I see your face in every sunset, hear your voice in every breeze
But the silence in this farmhouse, just echoes my unease
I shoulda held you tighter, darling, shoulda fought with all my might
But the distance won the battle, and stole away my light
(Chorus)
Miles of sorrow stretch between us, a highway paved with tears
Each mile a memory fading, swallowed by the passing years
We said forever, honey, but forever couldn't hold
Against the pull of distance, a story left untold
(Outro)
Miles of sorrow… miles and miles of sorrow…

miles_of_heartache.title: Miles of Heartache
miles_of_heartache.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Sunrise paints the cotton fields, another day begins
But the light don't shine so bright no more, since you left for distant lands
Said you'd write, said you'd call, promised you'd always be near
But the miles stretched out between us, fueled by doubt and fear.
(Chorus)
Miles of heartache, winding roads of sorrow,
Every mile a memory, of a love we couldn't borrow
From the future, from the years, from a life we'd planned to share
Now just miles of heartache, and a love beyond repair.
(Verse 2)
Remember dancin' in the moonlight, beneath the summer sky?
Your laughter echoed in the fields, a song that made me fly.
We built a dream on promises, as solid as the ground
But the city lights and city life, tore our love unbound.
(Chorus)
Miles of heartache, winding roads of sorrow,
Every mile a memory, of a love we couldn't borrow
From the future, from the years, from a life we'd planned to share
Now just miles of heartache, and a love beyond repair.
(Bridge)
I keep your picture by my bed, a faded photograph
A constant reminder of the love, that distance stole, alas.
Maybe someday I'll forget, the pain that cuts so deep
But until then, these miles of heartache, are the only truth I keep.
(Chorus)
Miles of heartache, winding roads of sorrow,
Every mile a memory, of a love we couldn't borrow
From the future, from the years, from a life we'd planned to share
Now just miles of heartache, and a love beyond repair.
(Outro)
Miles… miles of heartache… yeah… gone…

friday_night_lights_in_honky_tonk_heaven.title: Friday Night Lights in Honky Tonk Heaven
friday_night_lights_in_honky_tonk_heaven.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Sun sinkin' low, week's work is done
Dust off my boots, time for some fun
Got my guitar, worn and well-loved
Ready to sing 'bout the heart I've been robbed
(Chorus)
Friday night lights in Honky Tonk Heaven, yeah
Whiskey's flowin', music's playin' clear
Broken hearts mendin', laughter ringin' true
Underneath the neon glow, me and you
(Verse 2)
Saw ol' Jimmy Joe, lookin' kinda blue
Lost his woman, don't know what to do
But tonight's for forgettin', leavin' troubles behind
Let the music wash over, ease his weary mind
(Chorus)
Friday night lights in Honky Tonk Heaven, yeah
Whiskey's flowin', music's playin' clear
Broken hearts mendin', laughter ringin' true
Underneath the neon glow, me and you
(Bridge)
This ain't no church, but souls find grace here
In the twangin' guitars and the clinking of beer
We share our stories, our joys and our pain
Findin' solace 'til the sun shines again
(Chorus)
Friday night lights in Honky Tonk Heaven, yeah
Whiskey's flowin', music's playin' clear
Broken hearts mendin', laughter ringin' true
Underneath the neon glow, me and you
(Outro)
Yeah, Friday night lights, burnin' bright and bold
Another story in this Honky Tonk's been told

taco_town.title: Taco Town
taco_town.lyrics:
Verse 1
Rolled into town with a hunger to tame,
Saw a food truck sign, didn’t know the name.
“Taaah-cooows,” I drawled, with a puzzled grin,
Somethin’ new was callin’, let the feast begin!

Chorus
It’s taco time, y’all, grab a messy bite!
Corn and meat, so cheap, lightin’ up the night!
Spicy kick, hands slick, lovin’ every thrill,
Taco time, givin’ my heart a fill!

Verse 2
Bit that tortilla, flavors burstin’ free,
Juice down my chin, felt like heaven to me.
Onions, cilantro, a little hot sting,
This workin’ man’s food makes my soul wanna sing.

Chorus
It’s taco time, y’all, grab a messy bite!
Corn and meat, so cheap, lightin’ up the night!
Spicy kick, hands slick, lovin’ every thrill,
Taco time, givin’ my heart a fill!

Bridge
Pass the salsa, let the good times roll,
Every bite’s a fire warmin’ up my soul!
From a stranger’s plate to a lover’s smile,
Tacos bring us closer, country style!

Chorus
It’s taco time, y’all, grab a messy bite!
Corn and meat, so cheap, lightin’ up the night!
Spicy kick, hands slick, lovin’ every thrill,
Taco time, givin’ my heart a fill!

Outro
(Claps, hollers, banjo twang)
Taco time, yeah, it’s my new jam,
From a small-town boy to a taco man!

sound_of_silence.title: Sound of Silence
sound_of_silence.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
One AM, bar closed down
Took a shot of whiskey, it ain't helpin' now
To shut my mind off, stop it from racin'
I turn to what I've been chasin'

[Chorus]
The sound of silence
I find it on the road at night drivin'
In my bed when the storm is outside it
It's like a choir singin' to my soul
I've been prayin' that I'll find it
In my head, so I can't deny it
When I do, you know I'll invite it
Into my heart and never let it go
It's the sound of silence

[Verse 2]
'Fore you know it, your life is half gone
Still tryin' to figure out where you belong
To shut my mind off, stop it from racin'
I turn to what I've been chasin'

[Chorus]
The sound of silence
I find it on the road at night drivin'
In my bed when the storm is outside it
It's like a choir singin' to my soul
I've been prayin' that I'll find it
In my head, so I can't deny it
When I do, you know I'll invite it
Into my heart and never let it go
It's the sound of silence

[Verse 3]
Everywhere I go, everywhere I go
It never seems to leave me alone
Everywhere I go, everywhere I go
I'm drownin' in this world

[Chorus]
And I need the sound of silence
I find it on the road at night drivin'
In my bed when the storm is outside it
It's like a choir singin' to my soul
I've been prayin' that I'll find it
In my head, so I can't deny it
When I do, you know I'll invite it
Into my heart and never let it go
It's the sound of silence

runnin_late_to_church.title: Runnin’ Late to Church
runnin_late_to_church.lyrics:
Verse 1
Woke up with a stranger, tangled in the sheets,
Lipstick on my collar, boots stillMayor’s weight on my feet.
Clock’s tickin’ past nine, preacher’s gonna frown,
Got a potluck dish to save my soul in this town.

Chorus
Runnin’ late to church, with a sinner’s grin,
Last night’s whiskey still burnin’ deep within.
Tater casserole’s ridin’ shotgun in my truck,
Prayin’ for grace, hopin’ for luck.

Verse 2
Her perfume’s on my shirt, can’t shake the devil’s sway,
Dashboard Jesus judgin’ every mile I stray.
Gravy flies, I’m speedin’ down that old dirt road,
Gotta get to service ‘fore the choir sings.

Chorus
Runnin’ late to church, with a sinner’s grin,
Last night’s whiskey still burnin’ deep within.
Tater casserole’s ridin’ shotgun in my truck,
Prayin’ for grace, hopin’ for luck.

Bridge
Barstool confessions won’t cleanse my soul,
But a pan of cornbread might make the preacher whole.
Slide in the back pew, dodge the deacon’s stare,
Lord, forgive me, I’m almost there.

Chorus
Runnin’ late to church, with a sinner’s grin,
Last night’s whiskey still burnin’ deep within.
Tater casserole’s ridin’ shotgun in my truck,
Prayin’ for grace, hopin’ for luck.

Outro
(Claps, hollers, banjo twang)
Late to church, but I’m here with my dish,
Saved by the potluck, thank God for this wish!
